qas.question: Which term did Willett use in his 1907 proposal to refer to DST?
What phrase had replaced daylight saving time by 1911 as Willett's proposal evolved into draft legislation?
What word do speakers of Dutch use for DST?
What term do Italians use for DST that literally translates as "legal time"?
What does the Italian term for their winter time, ora solare, translate to in English?

context: In Britain, Willett's 1907 proposal used the term <a0_0>daylight saving<a0_0/>, but by 1911 the term <a1_0>summer time<a1_0/> replaced daylight saving time in draft legislation. Continental Europe uses similar phrases, such as Sommerzeit in Germany, <a2_0>zomertijd<a2_0/> in Dutch-speaking regions, kesäaika in Finland, horario de verano or hora de verano in Spain and heure d'été in France, whereas in Italy the term is <a3_0>ora legale<a3_0/>, that is, legal time (legally enforced time) as opposed to "ora solare", <a4_0>solar time<a4_0/>, in winter.
